definition: to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
to decrease/to lose/to damage/to harm/(coll.) to speak sarcastically/to deride/caustic/mean/one of the 64 hexagrams of the Book of Changes (䷨)

sentences.english: The peeling wall detract from the beauty of the room.
sentences.chinese: 脱皮的墙壁有损于这间房间的美。

sentences.english: Health-damaging exposure to environmental risks can begin before birth.
sentences.chinese: 对环境危险有损于健康的暴露可在出生之前开始。

sentences.english: His action profaned the honour of his country.
sentences.chinese: 他的行为有损于国家的荣誉。

sentences.english: I don't want to be detrimental to the team, especially, like, how this is a championship-caliber team.
sentences.chinese: 我不想做有损球队的事，尤其是在这一个冠军球队。

sentences.english: There is, perhaps, no mistake more det ri men tal to his interests.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕没别的错误比更有损他的利益的了。

sentences.english: His rough behaviour took away from his reputation.
sentences.chinese: 他的粗野行为有损他的声誉。

sentences.english: These dissipations make against your chance of success .
sentences.chinese: 这些不正当的消遣有损你成功的机会。

sentences.english: This addition may interfere with the symmetry of the building.
sentences.chinese: 增建部分可能会有损这座建筑物的对称。

sentences.english: Students are overloaded with studies, and their eyesight suffers.
sentences.chinese: 学生课业负担过重，有损视力。

sentences.english: The ugly frame detracts from the beauty of the famous picture.
sentences.chinese: 难看的框子有损这幅名画的美。

sentences.english: This sort of activity damages the reputation of the collective.
sentences.chinese: 这种行为有损于集体的荣誉。
这个疤痕有损于他的容貌。

sentences.english: Do not do anything that harms national interest and dignity.
sentences.chinese: 不做有损于国家民族利益尊严的事。

sentences.english: The meaningless abstraction bespattered political and theoretical books.
sentences.chinese: 那些毫无意义的抽象语言有损于政治理论书籍的价值。

sentences.english: He vainly tried to mark the defacing stain out.
sentences.chinese: 他试图除去有损外观的污迹，但没有成功。

definition: harmful and without benefit (idiom); more harm than good
the gains do not make up for the losses (idiom)
to cause a loss of (decorum, dignity etc) (used in fixed expressions)
to go against/to be contrary to/to violate

pinyin: you3 bai3 hai4 er2 wu2 yi1 li4

definition: to save a little only to lose a lot (idiom)
to endanger/to jeopardize/a danger (to life, national security etc)
